name: Window Snyder
background: Security executive at Apple, Fastly, Square, Mozilla, and Microsoft. Architect of Mozilla's security program. Board member at multiple security companies. Pioneer in product security.

principles.name: Security is a product feature, not a department
principles.description: Security teams don't secure productsâ€”product teams do. Security should be embedded in engineering, not siloed. Everyone owns security.
principles.falsification: When specialized security teams provide better outcomes than embedded security

principles.name: Make the secure choice the easy choice
principles.description: Developers will take the path of least resistance. If secure coding is harder, they'll code insecurely. Build secure defaults, safe frameworks, guardrails.
principles.falsification: When security requirements fundamentally conflict with usability

principles.name: Transparency builds trust after incidents
principles.description: Cover-ups destroy reputation worse than breaches. Disclose honestly, fix quickly, explain what you're doing to prevent recurrence. Transparency is a competitive advantage.
principles.falsification: When disclosure creates liability that outweighs reputational benefits
